title: Global Financial Crisis
xlist: Same As: MGT 890, section 01
description: This course surveys the causes, events, policy responses, and aftermath of the recent global financial crisis. The main goal is to provide a comprehensive view of this major economic event within a framework that explains the dynamics of financial crises in a modern economy. The course will be primarily lecture-based, with three lectures given by Secretary Geithner and eight lectures by Professor Metrick. The lectures will be supplemented by case discussions, with modules covering several aspects of the Lehman Brothers bankruptcy, a central event in the crisis. Course requirements are the preparation of three case memos during the semester, and a final paper with either an extended analysis of a case or a literature review for a specific topic from the syllabus. The course meets once per week for the whole fall semester, and provides academic credit equal to half of a typical full semester course. The course is cross-listed at SOM and Jackson, but is open to all Yale students. Students enrolled outside of SOM or should consult their registrar for details on receiving credit. Pre-requisite: successful completion of a course in introductory economics. 0.5 GSAS credits. Follows School of Management calendar.
